It should have a duration once it is freed from the bottle. It wouldn‚Äôt be a potion effect, it would probably just have a timer in its code telling it when it should float away (stop helping). I think 5 minutes would be a reasonable amount of time, unless these soul bottles are rare.

Maybe if you mine enough soul sand/soul soil you have a 2% or lower at spawning on of these. It will follow you ONLY while you in the Nether. If you go through a portal it will stay by the portal intel you come back.

This is an excellent idea! Quick tweaks/suggestions:
Soul Bottles should be craftable but a bit expensive, and be balanced by the fact that the soul only lasts about two minutes before dissipating. 

They should also be stackable up to 16, and dispensers will spit out the soul, which will immediately head to the nearest player and follow them.
The soul bottles should also spawn in desert tombs on rare occasion.

I would love seasons, but there‚Äôs just one problem with them. They would change blocks like leaves to colors players might not want. For example, if I terraformed with birch and spruce leaves, spruce may turn dark green, while the birch changes orange. It would be annoying. That‚Äôs not to say there aren‚Äôt workarounds, but it would be a challenge to incorporate that update without the drawbacks.

I think Fireflies would be a great addition to Minecraft! Here are some of my suggestions.

You would generally find Fireflies in meadows, underground mines, and not well-light areas. Their general light color is a muted yellow like torches but dimmer. Fireflies don‚Äôt illuminate much light, but if in big groups, you won‚Äôt miss it. They also come in different colors; some are spotted, like fungus mushrooms.

If you kill a firefly, it will drop its light. You can then go to the crafting table and add it to a lantern. And you can also add dyes to the fireflies‚Äô light to change colors. They are also considering adding Chinese lanterns; you could use fireflies‚Äô light to create them.

But if you want to capture a firefly, use a glass bottle or a clear container. Perhaps, we can create clear glass jars in a shape of a flower pot? Then just like a flower pot, you can place it anywhere to display the fireflies. If we were to create a new jar out of glass, we could use different colors like the stained glass now.

If I think of any more ideas, I‚Äôll add them here. Let me know what y‚Äôall think! Thank you!

I was just about to post the exact same suggestion, I agree with everything.

A GUI should to be added and the books should appear corresponding to which slot the book is in.

Also your idea that types of books being different color is better than I wanted to go with, I wanted to suggest books to be dyed. If we would only use the 6 colors I could see it like this.
-Normal Books: Green
-Book ans Quills: Orange
-Signed Written books: Red
-Armor Enchantments: Purple (Protection, Feather Falling etc)
-Weapon and Tool Enchantments: Blue (Efficency, Sweeping Edge, Knockback, Flame, Charge etc)
-Universal Enchantments: Cyan (Mending, Unbreaking, Curse of Vanishing)

In any case I agree that the displayed color should depend on the book, whenever its the type or a dye, that way people can have orginized pretty libraries, like a shelf with full of red books or full of green books, it would a lot better for decoration.

As a mobile player, I also want to place book in any slot I want and not just from left to right (even if I need more precision). However, left to right placement could be keept if you interact with any other side of the chiseled bookshelf
